DataElement.preferredName: Maximum Total Ferritin Measurement Laboratory Procedure Outcome 0 Decimal Place Microgram per Liter Value
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The 0 decimal place microgram per liter numeric laboratory value measured, assigned or computed related to the assessment of the maximum total serum ferritin in a specimen.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Maximum Total Ferritin Measurement Laboratory Procedure Outcome
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: the largest possible quantity or degree._Pertaining to an entirety or whole, also constituting the full quantity or extent; complete; derived by addition._The determination of the amount of ferritin present in a sample._Any procedure that involves testing or manipulating a sample of blood, urine, or other body substance in a laboratory setting._The result of an action.

ObjectClass.preferredName: Maximum Total Ferritin Measurement Laboratory Procedure
ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: the largest possible quantity or degree.:Pertaining to an entirety or whole, also constituting the full quantity or extent; complete; derived by addition.:The determination of the amount of ferritin present in a sample.:Any procedure that involves testing or manipulating a sample of blood, urine, or other body substance in a laboratory setting.

Concepts.definition: The largest possible quantity or degree.
Pertaining to an entirety or whole, also constituting the full quantity or extent; complete; derived by addition.
The determination of the amount of ferritin present in a sample.
Any procedure that involves testing or manipulating a sample of blood, urine, or other body substance in a laboratory setting.

Property.preferredDefinition: A phenomenon that follows and is caused by some previous phenomenon.

ValueDomain.preferredName: Laboratory Procedure Integer::0 Decimal Place Microgram per Liter Value
ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: Any procedure that involves testing or manipulating a sample of blood, urine, or other body substance in a laboratory setting._A number with no fractional part, including the negative and positive numbers as well as zero.::0_An indication of the specific number of digits to be expected to the right of the decimal point in a line of numbers._A unit of mass concentration defined as the concentration of one microgram of a substance per unit volume of the mixture equal to one liter. The concept also refers to the unit of mass density (volumic mass) defined as the density of a substance which mass equal to one microgram occupies the volume of one liter._A numerical quantity measured or assigned or computed.

RepresentationTerm.preferredName: Laboratory Procedure Integer::0 Decimal Place Microgram per Liter Value
RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: Any procedure that involves testing or manipulating a sample of blood, urine, or other body substance in a laboratory setting.:A number with no fractional part.::0:An indication of the specific number of digits to be expected to the right of the decimal point in a line of numbers.:A unit of mass concentration defined as the concentration of one microgram of a substance per unit volume of the mixture equal to one liter. The concept also refers to the unit of mass density (volumic mass) defined as the density of a substance which mass equal to one microgram occupies the volume of one liter.:A numerical quantity measured or assigned or computed.

Concepts.definition: Any procedure that involves testing or manipulating a sample of blood, urine, or other body substance in a laboratory setting.
A number with no fractional part, including the negative and positive numbers as well as zero.
An indication of the specific number of digits to be expected to the right of the decimal point in a line of numbers.

A unit of mass concentration defined as the concentration of one microgram of a substance per unit volume of the mixture equal to one liter. The concept also refers to the unit of mass density (volumetric mass) defined as the density of a substance which mass equal to one microgram occupies the volume of one liter.
A numerical quantity measured or assigned or computed.
